dsls.title: CS Discoveries End of Course Student Survey

dsls.markdown:
### **This survey is anonymous** 

* This survey has 5 short parts.  
* The whole thing should take **15 minutes or less** to complete.

*Code.org takes your privacy very seriously.* Your responses here will be kept **anonymous**. No one, not even your teacher, can link your responses back to you as an individual.

We do this because we want you to **be as open and honest as possible**. We care about your experience in the course, and we make improvements based on what you say.

***

### Part 1: School in general

#### *First, we want to ask you about your thoughts and feelings about school, in general.*
dsls.teacher_markdown:
This mid-course survey should be administered **after** all class activities have taken place that you intend to teach during the semester. 

You will be able to see the anonymized results of the survey for your students.

Why is this survey here?

* A major goal of CS Principles is to broaden participation in computer science.
* It is crucial therefore to have insight into students' attitudes and beliefs about computer science before, during and after the course so we can measure the change over time.
* Completing it also helps us understand important improvements we can make to the curriculum to improve the teacher and student experience.


* Please help by having your students contribute to this vital dataset. Their voices make the difference!

questions.text: I am very good at school.
When I encounter a problem without an obvious answer, I am always able to figure out some way to solve it.
I think my schoolwork is interesting.
It is important for me to be good at my schoolwork.
It is hard for people like me to be accepted at my school.
I am treated with as much respect as other students at my school.
I can really be myself at school.

dsls.markdown:
### Part 2: Computer Science in general

#### *Next, we'd like to ask for your thoughts and feelings about Computer Science, generally.*

***

questions.text: I like computer science.
I think computer science is interesting.
I am better at computer science than other kids at my school.
When I encounter a computer science problem without an obvious answer, I am always able to figure out some way to solve it.
I have the ability to learn computer science.
It is important to me to be good at computer science.
People like me do computer science.
I think I could become a computer scientist one day.
Learning computer science has helped me in my other school subjects.

dsls.markdown:
### Part 3: You and computer science

#### *Next we ask for your thoughts about this computer science class and your future.* 

***

questions.text: I like this computer science class.
I feel comfortable in this computer science class.
I was treated with as much respect as other students in this computer science class.
I felt like I could be myself in this computer science class.
Sometimes I felt unsure whether I belonged in this class.
It has been hard for people like me to to be accepted in this computer science class.
Computer science is important for my future.
I want to take more computer science classes in the future.
I expect that I will use computer science in my job.

dsls.markdown:
### Part 4: The last month in this class For the next questions please focus on things that happened in your computer science class **during the past month**. ***

During the past month how often did your teacher do the following?

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Asked me to consider relationships between what I was learning in the lesson and real world problems (meaning actual events or situations within or outside of school).

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Connected a lesson or classroom activities to my own life (for example: by asking about my past experiences, or applying computer science to my daily life).

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Asked me to problem solve when something didn't work the way I wanted it to work.

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Asked me to explain the logic and reasoning supporting my solutions to problems.

dsls.markdown: During the past month how often did you do the following?

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Worked collaboratively with other students in a small group.

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Shared responsibility for activity and project work with group members.

answers.text: Once or more per class session

questions.text: Made my own choices about assignments.

dsls.markdown: ### This section asks the same two questions questions about each unit in the course.  We're interested in your feedback to help us make course improvements.

csd-post-survey-2018-topics-liked-FR.long_instructions: Please provide any other feedback you have about the units of this course.

dsls.markdown:
# Future topics

### What computer science topics are you interested in learning more about in the future?

For each of the topics below indicate whether you are interested in it. It's okay if you have not have heard of some of these things, just choose "not sure what this is".

questions.text: Computer Programming
Mobile App Design
Game Development
Web Development
Data Science
Cryptocurrency
Cybersecurity
Hardware
Robotics
Databases
Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
Networking and the Internet
Parallel and Distributed Computing

csd-post-survey-2018-topics-want-FR.long_instructions: What other topics are you interested in learning about in the future?

dsls.markdown:
# **Thank you** 

### Thanks for you time and consideration completing this survey.

### Please leave any last thoughts you have below and **click submit** to complete the survey.

csd-post-survey-2017-FR_2018.long_instructions: Please provide any other feedback you have about your experience in the course.
